page.title: 12Ainsworth Isolation Hospital
page.content: {Ainsworth Isolation Hospital}was built in 1906 and was last used to treat{ {small pox}in 1966.In 1984 Bury Community Health Council wanted the hospital used for the younger chronically sick,but the Regional Health Authority wanted to sell the hospital so that other hospitals in the area,such as{Fairfield}and{Bury {General}could be developed. In January 1972 the home for the nurses at the hospital,{Paddock Leach, was demolished by being deliberately burnt down.This was done to prevent infection during the demolition. Paddock Leach,which dates back to the 18th century,was at one time a combined farmhouse and collective {weaving}shed.The top storey housed the hand looms.
